result.markdown:
--- title: "Take-home Ex02" description: "Take-home Ex02" date: "May 16, 2025" date-modified: "May 16, 2025" format: html author: "YUAN Yihao" editor: visual execute: eval: true echo: true warning: false freeze: true --- # VAST Challenge: Mini-case 1 Background Sailor Shift, a global superstar from Oceanus, began her career in "Oceanus Folk" music before achieving worldwide fame in 2028 with a chart-topping viral single. Passionate about promoting Oceanus Folk and supporting emerging artists, she frequently collaborates with established musicians. She was briefly part of the all-female band Ivy Echoes (2023–2026), whose members later pursued solo careers, further spreading the genre’s influence. In 2040, journalist Silas Reed aims to analyze Sailor’s rise and Oceanus Folk’s impact using a knowledge graph, requiring insightful visualizations to uncover her legacy and the genre’s evolution. # Project Objectives 1. Explore and understand the profile of Sailor Shift’s career 2. Illustrate how the influence of Oceanus Folk has spread through the musical world. 3. Develop a profile of what it means to be a rising star in the music industry # Install Packages ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true"} pacman::p_load(tidyverse, jsonlite, SmartEDA, tidygraph, ggraph, dplyr) ``` ::: # Import Data ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true"} kg <- fromJSON("data/MC1_release/MC1_graph.json") ``` ::: # Data Wrangling ## Inspect structure ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true"} str(kg, max.level = 1) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` List of 5 $ directed : logi TRUE $ multigraph: logi TRUE $ graph :List of 2 $ nodes :'data.frame': 17412 obs. of 10 variables: $ links :'data.frame': 37857 obs. of 4 variables: ``` ::: ::: ## Extracting the edges and nodes tables ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true"} nodes_tbl <- as_tibble(kg$nodes) edges_tbl <- as_tibble(kg$links) ``` ::: ## Initial EDA ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true"} ggplot(data = edges_tbl, aes(y = `Edge Type`)) + geom_bar() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Take-home_Ex02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true"} ggplot(data = nodes_tbl, aes(y = `Node Type`)) + geom_bar() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Take-home_Ex02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ## Graph Preparation ### Step 1 : Mapping from node id to row index ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true"} id_map <- tibble(id = nodes_tbl$id, index = seq_len( nrow(nodes_tbl))) ``` ::: This ensures each id from node list is mapped to the correct row number ### Step 2: Map source and target IDS to row indices ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true"} edges_tbl <- edges_tbl %>% left_join(id_map, by = c("source" = "id")) %>% rename(from = index) %>% left_join(id_map, by = c("target" = "id")) %>% rename(to = index) ``` ::: ### Step 3: Filter out any unmatched (invalid) edges ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true"} edges_tbl <- edges_tbl %>% filter(!is.na(from), !is.na(to)) ``` ::: ### Step 4: Creating the graph Lastly, `tbl_graph()` is used to create tiidygraph's graph object by using the code chunk below ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true"} graph <- tbl_graph(nodes = nodes_tbl, edges = edges_tbl, directed = kg$directed) ``` ::: ### Set the seed ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true"} set.seed(1234) ``` ::: # Solving the tasks ## Task 1 ## a. Who has she been most influenced by over time? ### Find works Sailor Shift involved in and What are these works reference to ### Select Edge Type: "InStyleOf", "InterpolatesFrom", "CoverOf", "DirectlySamples" ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true"} sailor_id <- nodes_tbl %>% filter(name == "Sailor Shift") %>% pull(id) sailor_works <- edges_tbl %>% filter(source == sailor_id, `Edge Type` %in% c("PerformerOf", "ComposerOf", "LyricistOf", "ProducerOf")) %>% pull(target) influence_edges <- edges_tbl %>% filter(source %in% sailor_works, `Edge Type` %in% c("InStyleOf", "InterpolatesFrom", "CoverOf", "DirectlySamples")) influencing_creators <- edges_tbl %>% filter(`Edge Type` %in% c("PerformerOf", "ComposerOf", "LyricistOf", "ProducerOf"), target %in% influence_edges$target) %>% pull(source) %>% unique() ``` ::: ### Rank by frequency ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true"} influencer_summary <- edges_tbl %>% filter(`Edge Type` %in% c("PerformerOf", "ComposerOf", "LyricistOf", "ProducerOf"), target %in% influence_edges$target) %>% group_by(source) %>% summarise(times = n()) %>% left_join(nodes_tbl, by = c("source" = "id")) %>% arrange(desc(times)) %>% select(name, `Node Type`, times) ``` ::: ### Visulisation ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true"} library(ggplot2) ggplot(influencer_summary[1:10, ], aes(x = reorder(name, times), y = times)) + geom_col(fill = "steelblue") + coord_flip() + labs(title = "Top Influencers of Sailor Shift", x = "Artist", y = "Number of Influenced Works") + theme_minimal() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Take-home_Ex02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-14-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### Find other artists collaborate with Sailor ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true"} sailor_id <- nodes_tbl %>% filter(name == "Sailor Shift") %>% pull(id) sailor_edges <- edges_tbl %>% filter(source == sailor_id, `Edge Type` %in% c("PerformerOf", "ComposerOf", "LyricistOf", "ProducerOf", "MemberOf")) # Works with sailor（songs, albums, groups） sailor_works <- sailor_edges$target co_edges <- edges_tbl %>% filter(target %in% sailor_works, `Edge Type` %in% c("PerformerOf", "ComposerOf", "LyricistOf", "ProducerOf", "MemberOf"), source != sailor_id) ``` ::: ### Get the frequency and names ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true"} collaborators <- co_edges %>% count(source, sort = TRUE) %>% left_join(nodes_tbl, by = c("source" = "id")) %>% select(name, n) %>% rename(times = n) ``` ::: ### Visulise the frequency and rank Top 10 collaborators ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true"} library(ggplot2) ggplot(collaborators[1:10, ], aes(x = reorder(name, times), y = times)) + geom_col(fill = "darkorange") + coord_flip() + labs(title = "Top Collaborators of Sailor Shift", x = "Artist", y = "Number of Collaborations") + theme_minimal() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Take-home_Ex02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-17-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ## b. How has she influenced collaborators of the broader Oceanus Folk community? Separate the question: Step 1: Find works Sailor involved in Step 2: Find who are influenced by Sailor Step 3: Count the frequency and see who are most influenced ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true"} sailor_id <- nodes_tbl %>% filter(name == "Sailor Shift") %>% pull(id) sailor_works <- edges_tbl %>% filter(source == sailor_id, `Edge Type` %in% c("PerformerOf", "ComposerOf", "LyricistOf", "ProducerOf")) %>% pull(target) downstream_edges <- edges_tbl %>% filter(`Edge Type` %in% c("InStyleOf", "InterpolatesFrom", "CoverOf", "DirectlySamples"), target %in% sailor_works) influenced_creators <- edges_tbl %>% filter(`Edge Type` %in% c("PerformerOf", "ComposerOf", "LyricistOf", "ProducerOf"), target %in% downstream_edges$source) influenced_artists <- influenced_creators %>% left_join(nodes_tbl, by = c("source" = "id")) %>% filter(str_detect(tolower(genre), "oceanus folk") | str_detect(tolower(name), "oceanus")) # library(dplyr) top_influenced <- influenced_artists %>% count(name, sort = TRUE) ``` ::: ### Create the graph ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true"} sub_nodes_ids <- unique(c( sailor_id, sailor_works, downstream_edges$source, influenced_creators$source )) sub_nodes <- nodes_tbl %>% filter(id %in% sub_nodes_ids) %>% mutate(index = row_number()) id_map <- sub_nodes %>% select(id, index) sub_edges <- edges_tbl %>% filter(source %in% sub_nodes_ids, target %in% sub_nodes_ids) %>% left_join(id_map, by = c("source" = "id")) %>% rename(temp_from = index) %>% left_join(id_map, by = c("target" = "id")) %>% rename(temp_to = index) %>% filter(!is.na(temp_from), !is.na(temp_to)) %>% transmute(from = temp_from, to = temp_to, `Edge Type`) influence_graph <- tbl_graph(nodes = sub_nodes, edges = sub_edges, directed = TRUE) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true"} library(ggraph) ggraph(influence_graph, layout = "fr") + geom_edge_link(arrow = arrow(length = unit(2, 'mm')), alpha = 0.5) + geom_node_point(aes(color = ifelse(name == "Sailor Shift", "Sailor", "Other")), size = 4) + geom_node_text(aes(label = name), repel = TRUE, size = 3) + scale_color_manual(values = c("Sailor" = "tomato", "Other" = "steelblue")) + theme_void() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Take-home_Ex02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-20-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ## Task 2: Develop visualizations that illustrate how the influence of Oceanus Folk has spread through the musical world. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true"} oceanus_nodes <- nodes_tbl %>% filter(str_detect(tolower(genre), "oceanus folk")) oceanus_ids <- oceanus_nodes$id edge_types_influence <- c("InStyleOf", "LyricalReferenceTo", "CoverOf", "InterpolatesFrom", "DirectlySamples") influence_edges <- edges_tbl %>% filter(source %in% oceanus_ids, `Edge Type` %in% edge_types_influence) influenced_nodes <- nodes_tbl %>% filter(id %in% influence_edges$target) influenced_summary <- influenced_nodes %>% count(genre, sort = TRUE) sub_nodes <- nodes_tbl %>% filter(id %in% unique(c(influence_edges$source, influence_edges$target))) %>% mutate(index = row_number()) id_map <- sub_nodes %>% select(id, index) sub_edges <- influence_edges %>% left_join(id_map, by = c("source" = "id")) %>% rename(temp_from = index) %>% left_join(id_map, by = c("target" = "id")) %>% rename(temp_to = index) %>% filter(!is.na(temp_from), !is.na(temp_to)) %>% transmute(from = temp_from, to = temp_to, `Edge Type`) ``` ::: ### Create Interactive graph ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(visNetwork) nodes_vn <- sub_nodes %>% mutate(id = index, label = name, group = genre, title = paste0("", name, "
Type: ", `Node Type`, "
Genre: ", genre)) %>% select(id, label, group, title) edges_vn <- sub_edges %>% mutate(title = `Edge Type`) %>% select(from, to, title) visNetwork(nodes_vn, edges_vn, height = "600px", width = "100%") %>% visEdges(arrows = "to") %>% visOptions(highlightNearest = TRUE, nodesIdSelection = TRUE) %>% visLegend() %>% visLayout(randomSeed = 42) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ## a. Was this influence intermittent or did it have a gradual rise? ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true"} oceanus_nodes <- nodes_tbl %>% filter(str_detect(tolower(genre), "oceanus folk")) oceanus_ids <- oceanus_nodes$id edge_types_influence <- c("InStyleOf", "LyricalReferenceTo", "CoverOf", "InterpolatesFrom", "DirectlySamples") influenced_edges <- edges_tbl %>% filter(source %in% oceanus_ids, `Edge Type` %in% edge_types_influence) influenced_targets <- nodes_tbl %>% filter(id %in% influenced_edges$target) %>% filter(!is.na(release_date) | !is.na(written_date)) %>% mutate(year = as.integer(substr(coalesce(release_date, written_date), 1, 4))) %>% filter(!is.na(year)) influence_yearly <- influenced_targets %>% count(year) %>% arrange(year) library(ggplot2) ggplot(influence_yearly, aes(x = year, y = n)) + geom_line(color = "steelblue", size = 1.2) + geom_point(color = "tomato", size = 2) + labs(title = "Oceanus Folk Influence Over Time", x = "Year", y = "Number of Influenced Works") + theme_minimal() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Take-home_Ex02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-23-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ## b. What genres and top artists have been most influenced by Oceanus Folk? ### Find Oceanus Folk Node and filter ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true"} oceanus_nodes <- nodes_tbl %>% filter(str_detect(tolower(genre), "oceanus folk")) oceanus_ids <- oceanus_nodes$id edge_types_influence <- c("InStyleOf", "LyricalReferenceTo", "CoverOf", "InterpolatesFrom", "DirectlySamples") influence_edges <- edges_tbl %>% filter(source %in% oceanus_ids, `Edge Type` %in% edge_types_influence) ``` ::: ### Find influenced object ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true"} influenced_nodes <- nodes_tbl %>% filter(id %in% influence_edges$target) ``` ::: ### Count frequency ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true"} top_genres <- influenced_nodes %>% filter(!is.na(genre)) %>% count(genre, sort = TRUE) top_artists <- influenced_nodes %>% filter(`Node Type` == "Person") %>% count(name, sort = TRUE) ``` ::: ### Visualisation Top 10 Influeced genres ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true"} library(ggplot2) ggplot(top_genres[1:10, ], aes(x = reorder(genre, n), y = n)) + geom_col(fill = "darkgreen") + coord_flip() + labs(title = "Top Genres Influenced by Oceanus Folk", x = "Genre", y = "Number of Influenced Nodes") + theme_minimal() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Take-home_Ex02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-27-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ## c. On the converse, how has Oceanus Folk changed with the rise of Sailor Shift? From which genres does it draw most of its contemporary inspiration? ### Find all Oceanus Folk Node ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true"} oceanus_nodes <- nodes_tbl %>% filter(str_detect(tolower(genre), "oceanus folk"), `Node Type` %in% c("Song", "Album")) ``` ::: ### Extract and analysis ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true"} oceanus_with_year <- oceanus_nodes %>% filter(!is.na(release_date) | !is.na(written_date)) %>% mutate(year = as.integer(substr(coalesce(release_date, written_date), 1, 4))) %>% filter(!is.na(year)) ``` ::: ### Get the Frequency ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true"} library(tidyr) genre_by_year <- oceanus_with_year %>% separate_rows(genre, sep = ",\\s*") %>% count(year, genre) %>% arrange(year, desc(n)) ``` ::: ### Visualisation ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true"} ggplot(genre_by_year, aes(x = year, y = n, fill = genre)) + geom_area(alpha = 0.7) + labs(title = "Evolution of Oceanus Folk and Related Genres", x = "Year", y = "Number of Works") + theme_minimal() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Take-home_Ex02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-31-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### Filter Oceanus Folk Aritst ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true"} oceanus_ids <- nodes_tbl %>% filter(str_detect(tolower(genre), "oceanus folk")) %>% pull(id) folk_artists <- edges_tbl %>% filter(target %in% oceanus_ids, `Edge Type` %in% c("PerformerOf", "ComposerOf", "LyricistOf", "ProducerOf")) %>% pull(source) %>% unique() candidate_artists <- nodes_tbl %>% filter(id %in% folk_artists, `Node Type` == "Person", name != "Sailor Shift") ``` ::: ### To predict the potential artists, should find some specific characteristics 1. Check the amount of works ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true"} artist_activity <- edges_tbl %>% filter(source %in% candidate_artists$id, `Edge Type` %in% c("PerformerOf", "ComposerOf", "LyricistOf", "ProducerOf")) %>% count(source, name = "num_works") ``` ::: 2. Check if collaborate with Celebrates ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true"} sailor_id <- nodes_tbl %>% filter(name == "Sailor Shift") %>% pull(id) sailor_works <- edges_tbl %>% filter(source == sailor_id, `Edge Type` %in% c("PerformerOf", "ComposerOf", "LyricistOf", "ProducerOf")) %>% pull(target) collab_with_sailor <- edges_tbl %>% filter(target %in% sailor_works, source %in% candidate_artists$id) %>% distinct(source) %>% mutate(collab_sailor = 1) ``` ::: 3. What are the influence ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true"} artist_influenced <- edges_tbl %>% filter(`Edge Type` %in% c("InStyleOf", "CoverOf", "DirectlySamples"), target %in% edges_tbl$target[edges_tbl$source %in% candidate_artists$id]) %>% count(source, name = "num_influenced") ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true"} candidates <- candidate_artists %>% left_join(artist_activity, by = c("id" = "source")) %>% left_join(artist_influenced, by = c("id" = "source")) %>% left_join(collab_with_sailor, by = c("id" = "source")) %>% mutate(across(c(num_works, num_influenced, collab_sailor), ~replace_na(., 0))) %>% mutate(score = num_works + num_influenced * 2 + collab_sailor * 3) ``` ::: Predictions base on the result ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true"} top_candidates <- candidates %>% arrange(desc(score)) %>% select(name, num_works, num_influenced, collab_sailor, score) %>% slice(1:3) top_candidates ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 × 5 name num_works num_influenced collab_sailor score 1 Yang Wan 30 0 0 30 2 Rüdiger Graf 18 0 0 18 3 Filippo Pelli 17 0 0 17 ``` ::: :::
